intro: Lessingia nemaclada, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry conditions. It is an annual or biennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds.
